column4: Hi all, I just upgraded ntfs-3g and now I can't write to my ntfs partitions even though they should be mounted correctly. Debug info is here http://paste.ubuntu.com/84111/ - please help. I cam usually fix my own problems but this makes no sense to me.
Were you able to write to your partitions prior to upgrading?
Yes, I was.
I don't know what version I upgraded _from_ though.
It says on line 12 it's mounted as rw
Exactly, that's what I don't get. When I try to write to the partition (as with the touch command) it says it _isn't_ mounted rw.
how are you mounting it? In fstab?
Yes.
could you pastebin your fstab file?
I'll paste you the line: UUID=1A81229A5F8AF86E /media/storage  ntfs    defaults,umask=0002,uid=1000,gid=100 0 1
Do you need any special mounting options? Or are the defaults fine?
I'm not sure what you mean?
Alright, that answers my question anyway. Are you running Intrepid?
Actually I'm running Mint, but it's based on Hardy and uses its repos.
The ntfs-3g package was also from hardy repos.
OK, sure! Here's a graphical config program: sudo apt-get install ntfs-config
Thanks, I'll try that :)
And thank you for your time.
No problem! I'm just giving back after all the help I've received here. Check out this for more: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/MountingWindowsPartitions/ThirdPartyNTFS3G
Launch that via gksudo ntfs-config and check the boxes :P
Don't worry, I got it ;)
Wow, that thing rewrites the _entire_ fstab file... kind of scary, but it seems to have preserved the options of other partitions, so no worry, just a quick scare.
It works now - thank you again.
No problem! Actually, I should install that...
